intro: Acianthera saurocephala, commonly known as the "lizard's head orchid," is a species of orchid native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its unique, elongated flower that resembles the head of a lizard, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in rocky or wooded areas and prefers well-drained soil. It produces showy, violet-colored flowers that bloom during the summer months. Acianthera saurocephala is a terrestrial orchid with a slender, upright stem and narrow, grass-like leaves.
